item.title: Opening ports
item.dc:creator: @moerin moerin
item.description:
@moerin wrote:

hell boi:

ok this laptop was given to me 2 months ago[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 01, 2008, 02:25:26 PM[/size][hr]so does that mean i dont have to port forward?[/quote][quote=“Olli3, post:15, topic:177430”]if you can connect to your sever , than no

U need to Portforward, go to Start and search for Run.
Type in cmb and u will see Ur name> <-- Then type in Ipconfig.
U will see ur ip as 192.blahblah. and then u will see ur IPadress type it in at ur Adres balk, then u see Loggin then use [quote=“moerin, post:12, topic:177430”][quote author=hell boi link=topic=238340.msg2024954#msg2024954 date=1201843019]
as i said in my other topic i cannot portforward because my router keeps asking me for user and pass

i dont use a moderm
[/quote]
The pass wil be admin NO big A
And the Username will be admin too NO BIG A
I got a Router too.[/quote]
This and u will see the PortForward, For more information go to http://www.portforward.com/
Or go to
[hr]
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,193370.0.html
for the most information about Portforward and onther servers.

[hr]

~0bby
[hr]

item.title: Opening ports
item.dc:creator: @Olli3 Olli3
item.description:
@Olli3 wrote:

Ok , how to open a port.
1.Go to Control Panel
2. Click “Control Panel Home”
3. Click “Allow A Program Through Windows Firewall”
4. Press “Continue”
5. Click “Add Port”
6.Type in your Server name and for port type in “43594”
There ya go! And Check mark by your server name to let it though
(Make sure the box is checked!)

Read full topic
